intro: Thesium dmmagiae, commonly known as the dwarf thesium, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant typically grows in well-drained, sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is native to certain regions of southern Africa, where it is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Thesium dmmagiae is considered a rare and endangered species.
